Package biz.gabrys.lesscss.compiler2.filesystem

Class FtpFileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • biz.gabrys.lesscss.compiler2.filesystem.FtpFileSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileSystem
    public class FtpFileSystem
extends Object
implements FileSystem

    Represents a file system accessible via FTP protocol.

    Example paths:

    • ftp://example.org/style.less
    • ftp://example.org/styles/main.less

    Warning: requires Apache Commons Net library in the class path.

    Since:
    2.0.0

      • isAvailable

        public static boolean isAvailable()
        Tests whether the file system is available (all requirements are met).
        Returns:
        true whether the FTP file system is available, otherwise false.

      • configure

        public void configure​(Map<String,String> parameters)
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Configures this file system. This method is called only once after the file system has been created.
        Specified by:
        configure in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        parameters - the map with parameters (cannot be null).

      • isSupported

        public boolean isSupported​(String path)
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Tests whether a file path is supported. This method should return true only when this file system allows to do all operations:
        • normalize file paths
        • expand file paths redirections
        • checking if files specified by paths exist
        • fetch files data
        Specified by:
        isSupported in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        path - the path to verify (never null).
        Returns:
        true whether the file path is supported, otherwise false.

      • normalize

        public String normalize​(String path)
                 throws URISyntaxException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Normalize a path. A normalized path is an absolute path where at least:
        1. all "." segments are removed
        2. if ".." segment is preceded by a non-".." segment then both of these segments are removed.
        Examples:
        • C:\Users\less\style.less
        • /home/user/less/style.less
        • http://www.example.org/style.less
        Specified by:
        normalize in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        path - the path to normalize (never null).
        Returns:
        the normalized path (never null).
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException
        See Also:
        FileSystem.isSupported(String)

      • expandRedirection

        public String expandRedirection​(String path)
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Returns a direct and normalized path to a resource. Example: if a path is equal to "http://example.org/style.less", but this URL forwards to "/static/style.less", then the method will return "http://example.org/static/style.less".
        Specified by:
        expandRedirection in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        path - the normalized file path (never null).
        Returns:
        the direct normalized path to the resource (never null). If the path is already a direct path, it should return that path.
        See Also:
        FileSystem.normalize(String)

      • exists

        public boolean exists​(String path)
               throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Tests whether a direct normalized file path point to an exiting file.
        Specified by:
